page.title: 12DECCA STATION: NEAR DOUNBY
page.content: The{Decca Station}is in Sandwick, not far from Dounby village. It's main job is to send out signals to aeroplanes and boats, within 200 miles or so, to help them{navigate. This lets them know where they are so that they can keep clear of rocks or wrecks in the area. Inside there are control boxes and transmitters. A machine sounds a bell if anything goes wrong. There are two diesel generators which power the station during power-cuts in winter. There is also a set of stand-by batteries used in power-cuts until the generators can be started. Dounby is the "master" station for three others which are called "slaves". Radio waves go out every 20 seconds from three huge ariels outside in the field.
